page.title: 02Agricultural Engineers
page.content: { Tuckwell's}started in{1975}with 2.1/2 acres of land that belonged to {Ardleigh Hall Farm.} They began with only 2 people and now employ 15 people, 5 from Ardleigh. { They mend}10 tractors a week and from {mid July to September}they do innumerable repairs as quickly as possible.{ In winter,}they do full services. It takes 1.1/2 weeks to service a combine and two days for a tractor. The men work a 40-50 hour week.Tuckwell{repairs}machinery from {Essex and Suffolk.}They have about 250 customers per year. { Tuckwell also sells machinery,}some British but mainly foreign from Germany, America and France. They sell mostly John Deere tractors. In the year from August 1984 they sold 7 new and 1 second-hand combines and 45 new and 40 second-hand tractors.
